hanzi-su-wiki:
緑

Значения

Зелень, зелёный цвет

Мнемоника

Искажено. Ткань из ниток 糸 цвета свежеободранного дерева 录. Вверху — рука 彐, горизонталь показывает, что верхушка срезана. Ниже — стружки.

Варианты

綠, 绿

lǜ

绿
heisig_constituent: green, thread, spiderman, dustpan, broom, grains of rice
koohiiStory1: When you attend a green tea (緑茶=りょくちゃ) ceremony, you can cherish the threadwork on the kimonos people don, the broom-like whisk (茶筌 =ちゃせん) you use to grind up your tea, and the delicious rice cakes you eat with your tea!
koohiiStory2: In summer, all of Japan turns green with the green threads that fan out like brooms to later produce grains of rice. An easy image if you have ever looked out the window of the train to see all the summer rice paddies...
jp_readingExamples: 緑茶 (りょくちゃ), 緑陰 (みどりいん), 新緑 (しんりょく), 緑 (みどり)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If you see a wolverine in the water playing with a piece of thread, there’s no doubt that it’s green. Wolverines love green thread. Almost as much as they love the water.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture this wolverine playing with the green thread. It’s like a little kitten with yarn. That wolverine loves that green thread. Picture how cute it is as it plays with the thread and coos in happiness.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Midori (みどり) is a green colored melon liqueur with a sweet, fruity taste. This wolverine is too young to drink alcohol like Midori, so he just sticks to drinking water.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: If you’ve ever had Midori before, imagine that taste. It’s also green, so that’s an easy way to remember this kanji. If you haven’t had it, just picture the taste of melon and imagine that flavor on your tongue.
Ru_Notes: Сравни: 縁 (ふち、エン связь, судьба, край), 録 (しるす、ロク запись)
Ru_Radicals: 小 (маленький), 幺 (короткая нить), ヨ, 水 (вода), 糸 (нить), 隶 (раб)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: you give a watery yo (录) when the thread (糸) is green

緑(みどり): green

緑字的基本解释

緑
lǜ

緑
lù
均见“绿”。

緑字的汉语字典释义

[①]［bù］
［《廣韻》分勿切，入物，非。］
(1)无，没有。
(2)非，不是。
(3)不到，未。
(4)副词。表否定。
(5)副词。表禁止。勿，不要。
(6)副词。单用，做否定性的回答。
(7)副词。方言。用在句末表示疑问，跟反复问句的作用相等。
(8)副词。用在动补结构中间，表示不可能达到某种结果。
(9)副词。“不”字的前后叠用相同的名词，表示不在乎或不相干。
(10)副词。跟“便”“就”搭用，表示选择。
(11)副词。方言。不用；不要（限用于某些套语）。
(12)助词。无义。用以足句或加强语气。
(13)助词。无义。表示反问语气。
(14)通“丕”。大。
[②]［fǒu］
［《廣韻》方久切，上有，非。］
同“否1”。
[③]［fōu］
［《廣韻》甫鳩切，平尤，非。］
姓。汉有不疑。见《後汉书·皇甫规传》。
[④]［fū］
［《集韻》風無切，平虞，非。］
花蒂。
[⑤]［pǐ］
［《韻补》補美切，上紙］
通“否2”。<

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［bù］
["Guangyun" is divided into do not cut, into things, not. ]
(1) No, no.
(2) No, no.
(3) No, no.
(4) Adverbs. Table negation.
(5) Adverbs. Table prohibited. Don't, don't.
(6) Adverbs. Use it alone to make a negative answer.
(7) Adverbs. dialect. Used at the end of a sentence to express a question, it is equivalent to a repeated question.
(8) Adverbs. Used in the middle of the dynamic compensation structure, it means that it is impossible to achieve a certain result.
(9) Adverbs. The same nouns are used before and after the word "bu", which means that they don't care or are irrelevant.
(10) Adverbs. Used with "convenience" and "just" to indicate choice.
(11) Adverbs. dialect. No; don't (limited to certain phrases).
(12) Particles. Meaningless. Use full sentences or to strengthen the tone.
(13) Particles. Meaningless. Indicates a rhetorical tone.
(14) Link "Pi". Big.
[②]［fǒu］
["Guangyun" Fang Jiu cut, there is no. ]
Same as "No 1".
[③] [fōu]
["Guangyun" Fu Jiuqie, Pingyou, Fei. ]
name. Han has no doubts. See "Book of the Later Han·Huangfu Rules Biography".
[④]［fū］
["Jiyun" wind is not cut, Pingyu, non. ]
Flower pedicle.
[⑤] [pǐ]
["Yunbu" to make up the beauty and cut, put on paper]
Pass "No 2".
green

Name meaning
Nothing.
lǜ, lù
яп. вм. 绿
Radicals: 糸, ヨ, 水  (thread, wolverine, water)
Meaning Mnemonic
If you see a wolverine in the water playing with a piece of thread, there’s no doubt that it’s green. Wolverines love green thread. Almost as much as they love the water.
Picture this wolverine playing with the green thread. It’s like a little kitten with yarn. That wolverine loves that green thread. Picture how cute it is as it plays with the thread and coos in happiness.
Reading Mnemonic
Midori (みどり) is a green colored melon liqueur with a sweet, fruity taste. This wolverine is too young to drink alcohol like Midori, so he just sticks to drinking water.
If you’ve ever had Midori before, imagine that taste. It’s also green, so that’s an easy way to remember this kanji. If you haven’t had it, just picture the taste of melon and imagine that flavor on your tongue.
